org.dspace.servicemanager.config
Class DSpaceConfig

java.lang.Object
  org.dspace.servicemanager.config.DSpaceConfig

public final class DSpaceConfig
extends java.lang.Object

This represents a single config setting for a DSpace instance.

Author:
Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ gmail.com)

Method Detail

getBeanProperty

public java.lang.String getBeanProperty()
Gets the part before the @ in a config line.

Returns:
the bean property if there is one OR null if this is not a bean config

getBeanName

public java.lang.String getBeanName()
Get the part after the @ in a config line.

Returns:
the bean name which the property goes with OR null if there is none

isActivator

public boolean isActivator()
Indicates that this configuration is for an activator (a class that implements Activator).

Returns:
true if this config is for an activator OR false if not

isActivatorClass

public boolean isActivatorClass()
Indicates this is a config for an activator class (a class which will be started as a service during the service manager startup).

Returns:
true if this is a config for an activator class OR false if not

getActivatorClassName

public java.lang.String getActivatorClassName()
Get the classname of the activator defined by the activator string if there is one. This will be the activator class or the class which should be activated. Check the isActivator() and isActivatorClass() booleans to see which.

Returns:
the activator class name OR null if this is not an activator config

getActivatorName

public java.lang.String getActivatorName()
Get the name to use for this activator (as defined by the activator string). This will always be set if the activatorClassName is set.

Returns:
the activator name OR null if this is not an activator config

getActivatorAutowire

public java.lang.String getActivatorAutowire()
Get the activator autowire string. Returns one of:
auto
determine which type of autowiring automatically
constructor
autowire the constructor
setter
autowire the setters by type
none
disable any autowiring (this will only start up the class using the default constructor)

Returns:
the autowiring setting (auto/constructor/setter/none) OR null if this is not an activator config
